The Molecular Entity¶

This document describes the EntityHandle and related classes.

ost.mol.CreateEntity()¶

Creates a new entity. The created entity is empty, that is, it does not contain any atoms, residues, chains, bonds or torsions. To populate the entity, use an Editors.

Returns:The newly created EntityHandle
class ost.mol.EntityHandle¶

The entity class represents a molecular structure. Such a structure is in general made up of one or more linear chains of residues, which in turn are formed by one or more atoms.

The interface of entities is tailored to biological macromolecules, but this does not prevent it to be used for molecules in general: An entity also represent a ligand or a collection of water molecules - hence the rather generic name.

FindChain(chain_name)¶

Get chain by name. See also GetChainList()

Parameters:
  • chain_name – Chain identifier, e.g. “A”
Returns:

A valid ChainHandle, if the entity contains a chain with the given name, an invalid ChainHandle otherwise.
GetChainList()¶

Get list of all chains of this entity. To access a single chain, use FindChain().

Returns:A list of ChainHandles
FindResidue(chain_name, res_num)¶

Get residue by chain name and residue number. See also GetResidueList()

Parameters:
  • chain_name – Chain identifier, e.g. “A”
  • res_num – residue number
Returns:

A valid ResidueHandle if the chain exists and the chain contains a residue of the given residue number, an invalid ResidueHandle otherwise.
GetResidueList()¶

Get list of all residues of this entity. To access a single residue, use FindResidue().

Returns:A list of ResidueHandles
FindAtom(chain_name, res_num, atom_name)¶

Get atom by chain name, residue number and atom name. See also GetAtomList()

Parameters:
  • chain_name – Chain identifier, e.g. “A”
  • res_num – residue number
  • atom_name – atom name, e.g. CA
Returns:

A valid AtomHandle if an atom matching the parameters could be found, an invalid AtomHandle otherwise
GetAtomList()¶

Get list of all atoms of this entity. To access a single atom, use FindAtom()

Returns:A list of AtomHandles
RequestXCSEditor([edit_mode=mol.EditMode.BUFFERED_EDIT])¶

Request XCSEditor for editing the external coordinate system. This call will fail when there are pending changes of the internal coordinate system.

Parameters:
  • edit_mode – Must be EditMode.BUFFERED_EDIT or EditMode.UNBUFFERED_EDIT. For more details, see the editor documentation.
Returns:

<pending_xref py:class=”EntityHandle” py:module=”ost.mol” refdoc=”mol/base/entity” refdomain=”py” refexplicit=”False” reftarget=”XCSEditor” reftype=”class”><literal classes=”xref py py-class”>XCSEditor</literal></pending_xref>
RequestICSEditor([edit_mode=mol.EditMode.BUFFERED_EDIT])¶

Request ICSEditor for editing the internal coordinate system, such as torsions, bond lengths and angle between two bonds. This call will fail when there are pending changes of the external coordinate system.

Parameters:
  • edit_mode – Must be EditMode.BUFFERED_EDIT or EditMode.UNBUFFERED_EDIT. For more details, see the editor documentation.
Returns:

<pending_xref py:class=”EntityHandle” py:module=”ost.mol” refdoc=”mol/base/entity” refdomain=”py” refexplicit=”False” reftarget=”ICSEditor” reftype=”class”><literal classes=”xref py py-class”>ICSEditor</literal></pending_xref>
Select(query, flags)¶

Perform a selection on the entity. The result of the selection is an EntityView which contains usually only a subset of chains, residues, atoms and bonds of the original entity.

Parameters:
  • query (Query) – The query to be executed. See Query for details.
  • flags – An ORed combination of QueryFlags.
Returns:

An entity view.
Raises :

QueryError when the query could not be executed due to syntactic errors.
CreateFullView()¶

Creates an entity view containing all chains, residues, atoms and bonds of this entity.

# these two lines are identical
full=ent.Select('')
full=ent.CreateFullView()
Returns:<pending_xref py:class=”EntityHandle” py:module=”ost.mol” refdoc=”mol/base/entity” refdomain=”py” refexplicit=”False” reftarget=”EntityView” reftype=”class”><literal classes=”xref py py-class”>EntityView</literal></pending_xref>
CreateEmptyView()¶

Creates an entity view pointing to this entity, but otherwise empty. This method is usually the starting point for manual entity view creation, e.g.

view=ent.CreateEmtpyView()
for atom in ent.atoms:
  if ComplicatedPredicate(atom):
     view.AddAtom(atom)
Returns:<pending_xref py:class=”EntityHandle” py:module=”ost.mol” refdoc=”mol/base/entity” refdomain=”py” refexplicit=”False” reftarget=”EntityView” reftype=”class”><literal classes=”xref py py-class”>EntityView</literal></pending_xref>
Copy()¶

Creates a deep copy of the entity.

Returns:A new EntityHandle that is an exact copy of this entity.

Note

alternative atom positions are not handled yet.

GetCenterOfAtoms()¶

Get center of atoms, that is the average atom position of the entity. Use GetCenterOfMass() to calculate the mass-weighted center of the entity.

Returns:<pending_xref py:class=”EntityHandle” py:module=”ost.mol” refdoc=”mol/base/entity” refdomain=”py” refexplicit=”False” reftarget=”geom.Vec3” reftype=”class”><literal classes=”xref py py-class”>geom.Vec3</literal></pending_xref>
GetCenterOfMass()¶

Calculates the center of mass of the entity. Use GetCenterOfAtoms() to calculate the non-mass-weighted center of the entity.

Returns:<pending_xref py:class=”EntityHandle” py:module=”ost.mol” refdoc=”mol/base/entity” refdomain=”py” refexplicit=”False” reftarget=”geom.Vec3” reftype=”class”><literal classes=”xref py py-class”>geom.Vec3</literal></pending_xref>
GetGeometricCenter()¶

Calculates the mid-point of the axis aligned bounding box of the entity.

Returns:<pending_xref py:class=”EntityHandle” py:module=”ost.mol” refdoc=”mol/base/entity” refdomain=”py” refexplicit=”False” reftarget=”geom.Vec3” reftype=”class”><literal classes=”xref py py-class”>geom.Vec3</literal></pending_xref>
GetMass()¶

Calculates the total mass of the entity by summing up the masses of all atoms.

Returns:The mass in Dalton
Apply(visitor)¶

Apply EntityVisitor to the entity. In Python, you shouldn’t bother using this function. EntityVisitory are mainly used in C++ to implement algorithms that operate are able to operate on EntityViews or EntityHandles.

FindWithin(pos, radius)¶

Find all atoms in sphere of given radius centered at pos. To turn the returned list of atoms into an EntityView, use CreateViewFromAtomList().

Parameters:
  • pos (geom.Vec3) – Center of sphere
  • radius – The radius of the sphere
Returns:

A list of AtomHandles
class ost.mol.ChainHandle¶
FindResidue(res_num)¶

Get residue by residue number. See also GetResidueList()

Parameters:
  • res_num – residue number
Returns:

A valid ResidueHandle if the chain contains a residue with matching residue number, an invalid ResidueHandle otherwise.
GetResidueList()¶

Get list of all residues of this chain. For peptide chains, the residues are usually ordered from N- to C-terminus.To access a single residue, use FindResidue().

Returns:A list of ResidueHandles
FindAtom(res_num, atom_name)¶

Get atom by residue number and atom name. See also GetAtomList()

Parameters:
  • res_num – residue number
  • atom_name – atom name, e.g. CA
Returns:

A valid AtomHandle if an atom matching the parameters could be found, an invalid AtomHandle otherwise
GetAtomList()¶

Get list of all atoms of this chain. To access a single atom, use FindAtom()

Returns:A list of AtomHandles
class ost.mol.ResidueHandle¶
FindAtom(atom_name)¶

Get atom by atom name. See also GetAtomList()

Parameters:
  • atom_name – atom name, e.g. CA
Returns:

A valid AtomHandle if an atom with the given name could be found, an invalid AtomHandle otherwise
GetAtomList()¶

Get list of all atoms of this residue. To access a single atom, use FindAtom().

class ost.mol.AtomHandle¶
class ost.mol.EntityView¶

Represents a subpart of an EntityHandle.

Functions¶

Boolean Operators¶

ost.mol.Intersection(view_a, view_b)¶

Calculates and returns the intersection of view_a and view_b. view_a and view_b must be views of the same entity.

Parameters:
  • view_a – first view
  • view_b – second view
ost.mol.Difference(view_a, view_b)¶

Calculates and returns the difference between view_a and view_b. view_a and view_b must be views of the same entity.The returned view will contain atoms, residues, chains and bonds that are in view_a and not in view_b.

Parameters:
  • view_a – first view
  • view_b – second view
ost.mol.Union(view_a, view_b)¶

Calculates and returns the union of view_a and view_b. view_a and view_b must be views of the same entity.The returned view will contain all atoms, residues, chains and bonds that are either in view_a, view_b or part of both views.

Parameters:
  • view_a – first view
  • view_b – second view

Other Entity-Related Functions¶

ost.mol.CreateViewFromAtomList(atom_list)¶

Returns a view made up of the atoms in atom_list. All atoms are required to be atoms of the same entity. Duplicate atoms are only added to the view once.

Parameters:
  • atom_list (AtomHandleListAtomViewList) – the atoms
Raises :

IntegrityError if atoms of different entities are encountered
Returns:

<pending_xref py:class py:module=”ost.mol” refdoc=”mol/base/entity” refdomain=”py” refexplicit=”False” reftarget=”EntityView” reftype=”class”><literal classes=”xref py py-class”>EntityView</literal></pending_xref>
